intro: Erythraea centaurioides, commonly known as the red-centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a valuable addition to both ornamental and ecological gardens.
